body_html:
We don't officially support odroid or BeagleBones, but I am surprised to see this error. I have some details on cross-compiling for the similar Pi platforms here:
https://petewarden.com/2017/08/20/cross-compiling-tensorflow-for-the-raspberry-pi/

I did see similar symptoms when I was cross-compiling and wasn't using matching alignment options on the Pi 3, which was fixed by some compile flags:
https://raspberrypi.stackexchange.com/questions/48225/whats-causing-these-crashes-after-cross-compiling

I don't know how this relates to your problem though, and since these are unsupported platforms, closing this bug.

body:
We don't officially support odroid or BeagleBones, but I am surprised to see this error. I have some details on cross-compiling for the similar Pi platforms here:
https://petewarden.com/2017/08/20/cross-compiling-tensorflow-for-the-raspberry-pi/

I did see similar symptoms when I was cross-compiling and wasn't using matching alignment options on the Pi 3, which was fixed by some compile flags:
https://raspberrypi.stackexchange.com/questions/48225/whats-causing-these-crashes-after-cross-compiling

I don't know how this relates to your problem though, and since these are unsupported platforms, closing this bug.
